org.morphus

Class MoSDK

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.morphus.MoSDK

  • public class MoSDK
extends Object
    SDK Toolkit class. This is the main factory class that will give you access to the stereo display and camera classes.

    Create an instance of this class inside your renderer or surface or even in activity by passing in the MoConfig object to the constructor.

    Use the factory method createDisplay(android.view.SurfaceHolder) to get handle to the Display object which will be required to setup the approriate 3D stereo environment for you applications needs.

    If you are using AbstractRenderer to extend your renderer then you will not need to worry about the Camera, otherwise create your own left-right camera using the createCamera(org.morphus.stereo.Camera.Channel)* method.
    Author:
    In Aikun Electronics., Ahmed Shakil
    See Also:
    createCamera(org.morphus.stereo.Camera.Channel), createDisplay(android.view.SurfaceHolder)
    Create Date
    1/19/14

      • createDisplay

        public static Display createDisplay(SurfaceHolder surfaceHolder)
        Creates a display for the given SurfaceHolder. This method takes into account if the end device is a S3D device or not.
        Parameters:
        surfaceHolder - surface holder
        Returns:
        When the S3D runtime libraries are available, it will return a StereoDisplay and when they are not available it will return a VoidDisplay instead.

      • createDisplay

        public static Display createDisplay(SurfaceHolder surfaceHolder,
                    Display.Layout layout,
                    Display.RenderMode renderMode)
        Creates a display for the given SurfaceHolder. This method takes into account if the end device is a S3D device or not.
        Parameters:
        surfaceHolder - Android Surface holder
        layout - Display layout type
        renderMode - Display render mode
        Returns:
        When the S3D runtime libraries are available, it will return a StereoDisplay and when they are not available it will return a VoidDisplay instead.

      • createDisplay

        public static Display createDisplay(Activity activity,
                    Display.Layout layout,
                    Display.RenderMode renderMode)
        Creates a display for the given Activity. This method takes into account if the end device is a S3D device or not.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • set3DModeParallel

        public static boolean set3DModeParallel(Context context, Display.TnMode mode)
        Convenience method to change the screen display mode for parallel rendering, you need to pass the current android context to this method
        Returns:
        true if the switch scuessful, false if not
        See Also:
        MoScreen.set3DModeParallel(Context, org.morphus.stereo.Display.TnMode)
        Context

      • set3DModeParallel

        public static boolean set3DModeParallel(Context context, int mode)
        Convenience method to change the screen display mode for parallel rendering, you need to pass the current android context to this method, and mode only equal 0, 1, 2
        Returns:
        true if the switch scuessful, false if not
        See Also:
        MoScreen.set3DModeParallel(Context, int)
        Context
